then.line: Okay. Hear me out:
The Moon!
The moon?
It's definitely a good ball.
So like...what, we would put a papier mache moon in the window?
Hmm...
What about a mirror pointed at the night sky?
So you want balls... and then next to those, just a mirror?
True. Maybe it would help if the mirror were also a ball?
Like a disco ball?
Perfect! Do you have one of those?
I mean, obviously. It's a Ball Museum. I'm just... not sure that counts as a nature ball.
It does if it reflects the moon!
...What are you picturing?
Actually no, don't tell me. Let's just try this out.
I've got a really really good one. Are you ready?
I'm ready.
Puffer fish. Nature's spikiest ball.
I think I'm starting to lose the plot here.
How do you mean?
You're trying to create a window that's going to appeal to Minty AND the general public.
Yes.
Okay. But surely Minty won't want to grab a puffer fish?
No, but she WILL want to admire the beauty of the ocean and its creatures.
Croco, I don't want to sound rude, but have you never owned a dog?
You know what, I haven't.
So I guess you probably know best! Let's do this thing!
Wait...
I think I just got a brainwave.
Oooh! I'm excited!
The cutest ball of all: a curled-up cat!
A cat?! In a window?
Have you ever passed a cat in a window without stopping to say hi?
You're a genius!
It's impossible to resist! And I have absolutely no doubt that Minty will agree.
You're really thinking on a new level today, Prota. And I like it.
Thanks, Croco!
Now let's see what we've got!
